property.name: text
property.value: Pressure of the engine air (in kPa)

property.name: text
property.value: Valve coefficient for valve 1

property.name: text
property.value: Valve coefficient for valve 2

property.name: Title
property.value: Air Management System Physical Plant

property.name: text
property.value: This model gives the dynamics of a simple aircraft air management system with the structure shown in the figure at the right. This structure takes air in from an engine, and by controlling valves 1 and 2, regulates the temperature of the cabin.

property.name: text
property.value: Double click on this comment to see the document on which this model is based.

property.name: text
property.value: Molar mass of air (in g/mol)

property.name: text
property.value: Ideal gas constant (in J/(mol * K)

property.name: text
property.value: Temperature of air out of the heat exchanger (in K)

property.name: text
property.value: This version approximates the one in the paper, eliminating the causality loop between Wh and Th.

property.name: text
property.value: Pressure at the fork (in kPa)

property.name: text
property.value: Mass flow rate of air from the engine (in kg/s)

property.name: text
property.value: Mass flow rate of air from the HX (in kg/s)

property.name: text
property.value: Mass flow rate of air through valve 2 (in kg/s)

property.name: text
property.value: The conditional here captures the property that the flow saturates at the speed of sound.

property.name: text
property.value: Mass flow rate of cold air through the heat exchanger (in kg/s)

property.name: text
property.value: This Limiter should not be needed, but the flow gets out of range for the tables given without it.

property.name: text
property.value: Mass flow rate of air through valve 2 (in kg/s)

property.name: _windowProperties
property.value: {bounds={321, 67, 1359, 814}, maximized=false}

property.name: text
property.value: Pressure of the cabin 1 (in kPa)

property.name: text
property.value: Temperature of engine air (warm) (in K)

property.name: text
property.value: Temperature of heat exchanger output (in K)

property.name: text
property.value: Outlet air pressure of valve 1 (in kPa)

property.name: text
property.value: This model descibes a fork that sends some engine air to valve 2 and some to the heat exchanger. Since air compresses, the fork can store air, so the total output air flow need not equal the input flow.

property.name: text
property.value: Mass flow rate of air from the engine (in kg/s)

property.name: text
property.value: Mass flow rate of air through the heat exchanger (in kg/s)

property.name: text
property.value: Volume of the fork (in m^3)

property.name: text
property.value: NOTE: Made-up numbers

property.name: text
property.value: NOTE: Initial value set to 1000 kPa (ten atmospheres). Note that setting it to 100kPa results in NaN due to taking the sqrt of a negative number.

property.name: text
property.value: Mysterious fork constant

property.name: text
property.value: Cross sectional area of HX (in m^2)

property.name: text
property.value: This version approximates the one in the paper, eliminating the causality loop between Wh and Th. Specifically, in Expression2, inside the sqrt(), instead of scaling by the average pressure divided by the average temperature, (Pv + Pc)/(Te + Th), it scales by the input pressure divided by the input temperature, Pv/Te. Thus, it doesn't get the density of air in the heat exchanger exactly right.

property.name: text
property.value: NOTE: Assert actor gives a reasonable error message rather than allowing NaN to be calculated.

property.name: expression
property.value: (R * Te / (M * Vfork)) * (Wi - Wv - Wh)

property.name: expression
property.value: sqrt( (Pv - Pc) * (2*M*AHX^2/(R*K)) * (Pv / Te) )

property.name: expression
property.value: Pv >= Pc

property.name: message
property.value: Valve pressure has dropped below cabin pressure.

property.name: expression
property.value: (Pv <= Pe/2) ? 6.67E-4 * C1 * Pe * sqrt(1/Te) : 4.72E-4 * C1 * (Pe + 2*Pv) * sqrt((1 - Pv/Pe)/Te)

property.name: expression
property.value: (Pc <= Pv/2) ? 6.67E-4 * C2 * Pv * sqrt(1/Te) : 4.72E-4 * C2 * (Pv + 2*Pc) * sqrt((1 - Pc/Pv)/Te)
